src:
Simpozij o prvem stoletju novomeških frančiškanov
06 Nov 2019, 12:50 by L. Markelj



Na simpoziju so zbrane pozdravili (spredaj od leve proti desni): frančiškanski provincial p. Marjan Čuden,  novomeški župan Gregor Macedoni in novomeški škof msgr. Andrej Glavan.



p. Marjan Čuden






Mlaji z napisom 550 let frančiškani med vami pred farno cerkvijo kažejo na praznično leto novomeških frančiškanov.





Novo mesto - Praznovanje 550-letnice prihoda frančiškanov v Novo mesto se je danes, na sam praznik zaveznika novomeških frančiškanov sv. Lenarta, nadaljevalo s simpozijem v organizaciji Frančiškanskega samostana Novo mesto in Slovenske frančiškanske province sv. Križ in v sodelovanju še z drugimi: Mestno občino Novo mesto, Ministrstvom za kulturo, Zgodovinskim arhivom RS, idr.
Simpozij, na katerem je zbrane pozdravil gvardijan samostana p. Tomaž Hočevar, so posvetili prvemu stoletju novomeškega frančiškanskega samostana.
V pozdravnem nagovoru je provincial Slovenske frančiškanske province sv. Križ p. Marjan Čuden poudaril , kako pomemben je pogled nazaj, »ki bo preveril naše korenine in nas umestil v prostor in čas,« ter preplet frančiškanov z ljudmi v Novem mestu, kar želi, da le še ostane. »Zato molite za nove duhovne poklice,« je dejal.
Novomeški škof msgr. Andrej Glavan je pomen novomeških frančiškanov in samostana opisal kot duhovni center tega prostora, župnijo sv. Lenarta pa za »srce škofije«, čeprav ni največja po velikosti, je pa številu vernikov, ki jo obiskuje. »Želim, da navzočnost frančiškanov tu še dolgo traja,« je dejal.
Tudi novomeški župan Gregor Macedoni je ob 550. obletnici poudaril pomen frančiškanov v Novem mestu, ki so nedvomno mestu dajali značaj regionalnega religioznega središča. Novo mesto je lahko postalo izobraževalno središče in pred trinajstimi leti smo dobili še svojo škofijo. "Hvala za vse, kar ste dobrega naredili za to mesto,« je dejal Macedoni in pozval k sodelovanju in sobivanju še naprej.

Šest predavateljev o frančiškanskem samostanu

Na simpoziju, ki sta ga vodila Mitja Sadek in Jure Volčjak, je s prispevki z različnih področij sodelovalo šest avtorjev.


Dunja Mušič

Arhivistka novomeške enote Zgodovinskega arhiva Ljubljana Dunja Mušič je v uvodnem referatu predstavila Novo mesto in njegovo družbo na prehodu iz srednjega v novi vek. Sledil je prispevek dr. Jureta Volčnjaka, arhivista v Arhivu RS, o sami ustanovitvi novomeškega samostana in njegovih prvih desetletjih. V zadnjem referatu prvega sklopa je dr. Janez Weis, kustos Mestne muzejske zbirke Črnomelj, predstavil plemenite podpornike, ki so omogočili ustanovitev samostana in njegovo gmotno preskrbo.
Drugi sklop predavanj na simpoziju je uvedel dr. Matej Hriberšek z Oddelka za klasično filologijo Filozofske fakultete Univerze v Ljubljani in sicer s predavanjem o kroniških zapisih o 1. stoletju novomeškega frančiškanskega samostana. Dr. Jože Škofljanec iz Arhiva RS je predstavil umestitev samostana v avstrijsko frančiškansko provinco in njegov prehod v bosansko-hrvaško provinco. Simpozij je zaključil dr. Janez Premk z Oddelka za umetnostno zgodovino Filozofske fakultete Univerze v Mariboru, v katerem je predstavil stavbno zgodovino najstarejšega dela samostana.

text:
Symposium on the First Century of the Franciscans of Novo mesto
06 Nov 2019, 12:50 by L. Markelj



The symposium welcomed the congregation (front from left to right): Franciscan Provincial p. Marjan Cuden, Mayor of Gregor Macedoni of Novo mesto and Bishop of Novo mesto, MSgr. Andrej Glavan.



p. Marjan Čuden






Young people with the inscription 550 years Franciscans among you in front of the parish church point to the festive year of the Franciscans of Novo mesto.





Novo mesto - Celebrating the 550th anniversary of the arrival of the Franciscans in Novo mesto today, on the very holiday of the ally of the Franciscan Franciscans of Novo mesto. Lenart, continued with a symposium organized by the Franciscan Monastery of Novo mesto and the Slovenian Franciscan Province of Sv. Cross and in cooperation with others: Novo mesto Municipality, Ministry of Culture, Historical Archives of the Republic of Slovenia, etc.
Symposium at which the Guardsman of the Monastery p. Tomaž Hocevar was dedicated to the first century of the Franciscan monastery in Novo mesto.
In his welcoming address, the Provincial of the Franciscan Province of the Cross p. Marjan Strange emphasized the importance of looking back, "which will check our roots and place us in space and time," and the interplay of Franciscans with the people of Novo mesto, which he wants to keep. "So pray for new spiritual professions," he said.
Bishop of Novo mesto msgr. Andrej Glavan described the importance of Franciscan Franciscan monasteries and the monastery as the spiritual center of this area, the parish of St. Lenart, however, for the "heart of the diocese", though not the largest in size, is the number of believers he attends. "I want the presence of the Franciscans here to last a long time," he said.
Mayor Gregor Macedoni also emphasized the importance of the Franciscans in Novo mesto, who undoubtedly gave the city the character of a regional religious center. The new city could become an educational center and we received our diocese thirteen years ago. "Thank you for all the good you have done for this city," Macedoni said, calling for co-operation and coexistence.

Six lecturers on the Franciscan monastery

The symposium, hosted by Mitja Sadek and Jure Volčjak, was attended by six authors.


Dunja Mušič

In the introductory paper, the archivist of the Novo mesto Historical Archives Unit, Dunja Mušič, presented Novo mesto and his company at the transition from the Middle Ages to the New Age. The following was the contribution of dr. Jure Volčnjak, archivist at the Archive of the Republic of Slovenia, on the very foundation of the monastery in Novo mesto and its first decades. In the last paper of the first set, dr. John Weis, curator of the Črnomelj City Museum Collection, presented noble supporters who enabled the establishment of the monastery and its wealth.
The second part of the symposium was introduced by dr. Matej Hriberšek from the Department of Classical Philology, Faculty of Arts, University of Ljubljana, with a lecture on chronic records of the 1st century Franciscan monastery in Novo mesto. Dr. Jože Škofljanec from the Archives of the Republic of Slovenia presented the location of the monastery in the Austrian Franciscan province and its transition to the Bosnian-Croatian province. The symposium was concluded by dr. Janez Premk from the Department of Art History at the Faculty of Arts, University of Maribor, in which he presented the history of the oldest part of the monastery.
